key_events.event: Chamath Palihapitiya's SPAC, American Exceptionalism Acquisition Corp. A (AEXA), launched with a focus on AI, energy, defense, and decentralized finance, allocating only 1.3% of the IPO to retail investors.
Nikola Corporation announced Lucid Group’s acquisition of Nikola’s production facilities and appointment of a new interim CEO, amidst ongoing financial losses and operational challenges.
Meta Wolf AG reported a negative accrual ratio, indicating its free cash flow was higher than its statutory profit, while unusual items impacted the statutory profit.
Pursuit Attractions and Hospitality expanded its revolving credit facility by $100 million, extending the loan’s maturity to 2030, and added its Costa Rican subsidiary as a co-borrower.
Bhagwan Marine’s stock increased by 22% over the past three months, with its ROE at 7.4% and a low payout ratio of 11%.
Xeros Technology Group plc experienced a market impact from weak global cues and the FTSE 100 and FTSE 250 indices closing lower due to disappointing trade data from China.
